We are the COVID-19 graduating class,

that scary pandemic that would not pass.

There were many things this virus took away,

Our prom, graduation, and our time to play!

We missed the end of our senior year,

which caused several of us to shed a tear.

We found out we're strong & will will beat this,

though there is much that our class did miss.

We know that we'll still get to celebrate

Although it will be at a later date.

Our historical class is unique and ready

With brains, attitude and a drive that is steady.

We'll beat this and we will succeed,

We will leave this behind and we'll take the lead.

Our future is bright because this too will pass -

We are the DB-TC COVID GRADUATING CLASS!

Karen Ham

post_text: Jessica J Zerbst, a 1994 graduate of Dollar Bay High School, passed away on December 3, 2017. Jessica was a very successful attorney in Madison, Wisconsin and was DBHS's commencement speaker in 2010. On behalf of everyone at DB-TC Area School, we send much love and our heartfelt sympathy to Jessica's parents, Ray & Sandy Zerbst (Class of 1977 grads) and her brother, Joe Zerbst (Class of 2000). Words cannot begin to express how sorry we are.
